Unnamed: 1: Vrinda Store wants to create an annual sales report for 2022.So that Vrinda can understand their customers and grow more sales 2023.
• Compare the salees and orders using single chart.
• Which month got the highest sales and orders?
• Who purchased more - men or women in 2022?
• What are different order status in 2022?
• List top 10 states contributing to the sales?
• Relation between age and gender based on number of orders.
• Which channel is contributing to maximum sales?
• Highest selling category?
Vrinda store Project Headings:
Index: A sequential number or identifier used to reference each record in the dataset.
Order ID: A unique identifier for each order placed by a customer. This helps in tracking and differentiating individual orders.
Cust ID: The unique identifier for each customer, allowing for customer-specific analysis and tracking.
Gender: Indicates the gender of the customer, which can be useful for demographic analysis.
Age: The age of the customer, which can be used to understand age group trends or preferences.
Date: The date on which the order was placed. This can be used for time-based analysis, such as identifying peak order days or seasonal trends.
Status: The current status of the order (e.g., "Shipped," "Pending," "Canceled"). This is useful for tracking the order’s progress and completion.
Channel: The sales or distribution channel through which the order was placed (e.g., online, in-store). This helps in analyzing channel-specific performance.
SKU (Stock Keeping Unit): A unique code assigned to each product to track inventory and sales by individual item.
Category: The product category (e.g., electronics, apparel) of the item ordered, allowing for analysis of sales by product type.
Size: The size of the product ordered (relevant for items like apparel or footwear).
Qty (Quantity): The number of units of each product ordered.
Currency: The currency used for the transaction (e.g., USD, EUR), which is important for financial analysis, especially in international sales.
Amount: The total monetary value of the order, which is useful for revenue analysis.
Ship-City: The city where the order is being shipped. This helps in analyzing geographic distribution of sales.
Ship-State: The state where the order is being shipped, useful for understanding regional trends.
Ship-Postal-Code: The postal or ZIP code for the shipping address, enabling more granular geographic analysis.
Ship-Country: The country to which the order is being shipped, useful for international sales analysis.
B2B (Business to Business): Indicates whether the order is a business-to-business transaction, which can differentiate between B2B and B2C (business-to-customer) sales for targeted analysis.
